intro: Hieracium sympycnodes, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow composite flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Hieracium sympycnodes is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
